metadata.dc:author: Arellano Gañán, R
Jiménez Gálvez, M
Herranz Fernández, L M
Pereira Sanz, I
Nam Cha, Syonghyun
metadata.dc:description: Amyloidosis of the seminal vesicles is a common finding in autopsies, with increased incidence in older population. It is usually asymptomatic. We report a case of symptomatic localized amyloidosis of the seminal vesicles, with hemospermia and suprapubic pain. Diagnosis was achieved through ultrasound-guided transrectal biopsy. Systemic amyloidosis must be ruled out through proper evaluation. Seminal vesicle enlargement secondary to amyloid deposit may be misdiagnosed as carcinomatous invasion.
metadata.dc:title: Amiloidosis localizada de vesículas seminales.
[Localized amyloidosis of the seminal vesicles].
